sub_topic: Calculation of heat capacity of a substance
message_1: Calculate the heat capacity of 50 grams of water at 25°C, given that the specific heat of water is 4.184 J/g°C.
message_2:
To calculate the heat capacity of 50 grams of water, we can use the formula:

Heat capacity (Q) = mass (m) × specific heat (c) × change in temperature (ΔT)

In this case, we are given the mass (m) as 50 grams, the specific heat (c) as 4.184 J/g°C, and the change in temperature (ΔT) is not given, but we can still calculate the heat capacity per degree Celsius.

Heat capacity (Q) = 50 g × 4.184 J/g°C

Heat capacity (Q) = 209.2 J/°C

So, the heat capacity of 50 grams of water at 25°C is 209.2 Joules per degree Celsius.
